page.title: 06LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Broadwell has just one main street with the houses built along both sides of it.The houses are roughly split between ones built in the 1800's and those built since the 1960's. Traditionly Broadwell was a farming village but few of the inhabitants work on the land now,most people work in the neighbouring towns. The 3 largest houses in the village are still farms with "Broadwell House Farm" being the largest. There do not appear to be street names but the houses themselves usually have names. Evidence of Broadwell's past can be found in the rows of terraced cottages, which were originally built for the farm labourers to live in.
